marketNews.title: State Budget Realization 8M25: Tax Revenue Remains Weak, Spending Accelerated
marketNews.content: The Ministry of Finance on Monday (9/22) presented the realization of the State Budget until August 2025. Here are some key points: State Revenue Remains Contracted, Below Seasonal Trend State revenue during 8M25 reached 1,638.7 trillion Rupiah (-7.8% YoY), equivalent to only ~57% of the 2025 State Budget outlook (vs. 8M24: ~63% realization of the 2024 State Budget). Tax revenue - which is the main contributor to state revenue - still experienced a decrease of -5.1% YoY during 8M25. The Ministry of Finance attributed the decline in tax revenue to the restitution factor, considering that gross tax revenue still rose +2.1% YoY during 8M25. State Expenditure Accelerated, Relatively in Line with Seasonal Trend State expenditure during 8M25 reached 1,960.3 trillion Rupiah (+1.5% YoY), equivalent to ~56% of the 2025 State Budget outlook (vs. 8M24: ~58% realization of the 2024 State Budget). Both central government spending (+1.5% YoY) and transfers to the regions (+1.7% YoY) recorded positive growth. The trend of state expenditure also showed an acceleration compared to previous months. For comparison, state expenditure during 1H25 only grew +0.6% YoY, while the realization for 5M25 was still down -11% YoY. The Ministry of Finance also reported that as of September 8, 2025, the realization of the Free Nutritious Meal program had reached 22.71 million beneficiaries with a budget realization of approximately 13 trillion Rupiah, equivalent to only 18.3% of the budget ceiling in the Ministry of Finance presentation of 71 trillion Rupiah. Previously, Finance Minister Purbaya, stated that his party would continue to monitor the realization of government program budgets and reallocate the budget if realization was slow. The 2025 State Budget realization during 8M25 resulted in a deficit of 321.6 trillion Rupiah or equivalent to 1.35% of GDP (vs. 8M24: 0.69% of GDP).

marketNews.title: Key Takeaway
marketNews.content: We assess that the acceleration of government spending towards the end of 2025 is needed to boost economic growth again in 2H25. Besides the general acceleration of spending, the government has also launched several initiatives such as liquidity injection and subsequent economic stimulus packages.

marketNews.title: Other hot matters you need to know...
marketNews.content: The DPR on Tuesday (9/23) ratified the 2026 State Budget Law (UU APBN 2026) with a target deficit of 2.68% of GDP and an economic growth target of +5.4% YoY. The 2026 State Budget also targets inflation at 2.5% YoY, the Rupiah exchange rate against the US Dollar at 16,500, the 10-year SBN yield at 6.9%, the Indonesian Crude Price at 70 US Dollars per barrel, oil lifting at 610 thousand barrels per day, and gas lifting at 984 thousand barrels of oil equivalent per day. Indonesia and the European Union on Tuesday (9/23) signed the Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA) in Bali. This agreement will eliminate tariffs for 80% of Indonesian products exported to the European market, including flagship commodities such as palm oil, fisheries, and textile products. Meanwhile, Indonesia will eliminate import duties on 98.5% of goods from the European Union, including cars and food products, and simplify entry procedures for European Union products. The Coordinating Minister for the Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, targeted this agreement to take effect on January 1, 2027. The government expects exports to the European Union to double in the first 5 years of the agreement's implementation. The Coordinating Minister for the Economy, Airlangga Hartarto, stated on Monday (9/22) that the government will extend the Value Added Tax borne by the Government (PPN DTP) incentive of 100% for the housing sector until 2026. Under this scheme, the government will fully bear the VAT on the purchase of new ready-to-occupy houses with a maximum selling price of 2 billion Rupiah. For properties priced around 2-5 billion Rupiah, the VAT exemption only applies to the first 2 billion Rupiah. Kontan reported that the government has prepared a ceiling for the 2026 PPN DTP incentive of 3.4 trillion Rupiah, targeting 40,000 units of new houses. Bank Indonesia recorded that the economy's liquidity, or broad money supply (M2), in August 2025 grew +7.6% YoY to 9,657.1 trillion Rupiah (vs. July 2025: +6.6% YoY). This development was driven by the growth of narrow money supply (M1) of +10.5% YoY and quasi money of +5.6% YoY. The DPR on Tuesday (9/23) approved Anggito Abimanyu as the chairman of the Deposit Insurance Corporation (LPS) board of commissioners for the 2025-2030 period, replacing Purbaya Yudhi Sadewa who was appointed Minister of Finance. Anggito currently serves as Deputy Minister of Finance. Kontan reported that Anggito's name was not included in the list chosen by the LPS selection committee in July 2025, but his name later appeared in a letter sent by President Prabowo Subianto to the DPR. Purbaya confirmed that Anggito will relinquish his position as Deputy Minister of Finance after being officially named Chairman of the LPS Board of Commissioners.

tickerNews.title: EMTK Buys 0.46% of SCMA Shares Worth IDR 105 Billion
tickerNews.content: The controller of Surya Citra Media, Elang Mahkota Teknologi (EMTK), purchased approximately 342.4 million SCMA shares at an average price of approximately 307 Rupiah per share from August 20 to September 22, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 105 billion Rupiah. Following this transaction, EMTK's ownership in SCMA increased from 66.43% to 66.89%.

tickerNews.title: TINS Targets 30,000 Ton Sn Ore Production in 2026
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Timah, Restu Widiyantoro, stated that the company is targeting tin ore production of 30,000 tons of Sn in 2026, an increase of +39.5% from the 2025 Work Plan and Budget (RKAP) of 21,500 tons of Sn. TINS itself is optimistic that it can achieve the 2025 tin ore production target, even though the tin ore production in 1H25 only reached 6,997 tons of Sn (-32% YoY) and processed tin production was 6,870 metric tons (-29% YoY). Restu explained that the formation of a task force to crack down on illegal tin mining can help the company achieve its target.

tickerNews.title: SIDO Announces Share Buyback Plan up to IDR 56 Billion
tickerNews.content: Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul announced a plan to buy back approximately 103.7 million shares (0.35%) during the period of September 23-December 22, 2025. The estimated funds for this buyback are 56 billion Rupiah, which is the remainder of the previous buyback allocation announced in March and June 2025. SIDO also maintained the buyback price limit up to 760 Rupiah per share.

tickerNews.title: Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) Plans to Add Over 100 Aircraft Until 2029 to Capture 50% Domestic Market Share
tickerNews.content: The Director of Garuda Indonesia, Reza Aulia Hakim, said that the company plans to add more than 100 aircraft until 2029, enabling the company to connect more than 100 flight routes and achieve a 50% domestic market share. Bisnis reported that GIAA's total fleet reached 78 aircraft as of August 2025 and the company will add 2 more aircraft by the end of 2025. Reza also mentioned that the President Director of GIAA, Wamildan Tsani, will travel to the US this week to discuss aircraft procurement plans with Boeing, which is part of a trade agreement between Indonesia and the US.

tickerNews.title: Agung Podomoro Land (APLN) Records Marketing Sales of IDR 1.02 Trillion in 8M25, Focusing on Landed Houses in 2H25
tickerNews.content: The Corporate Secretary of Agung Podomoro Land, Justini Omas, told Kontan that the company recorded marketing sales of 1.02 trillion Rupiah during 8M25, equivalent to 60% of the 2025 target of 1.7 trillion Rupiah. Entering 2H25, Justini mentioned that APLN will refocus development on the landed house segment, considering this segment has high absorption in line with consumer preferences.

tickerNews.title: Wijaya Karya (WIKA) New Contract Value Reaches IDR 5.24 Trillion in 8M25
tickerNews.content: The President Director of Wijaya Karya (WIKA), Agung Budi Waskito, stated that the company recorded a new contract value of 5.24 trillion Rupiah during 8M25 (-61% YoY). The new contracts were dominated by the construction support sector at 49.8%, followed by infrastructure and buildings at 33.8%.
